Plot the VAF of a set of segments

Source: R/inspect_segment.R
inspect_segment.Rd

Plot the VAF of a set of segments that map to some chromosome id, with a minimum number of mapped mutations and length. THe plot is a histogram of the VAF, coloured per segement. A maximum of 74 segements can be plotted in colour, otherwise colors are not used and the histogram is black. The plots are facetted by chromosome id and karyotype.

inspect_segment(
  x,
  chrs = c(paste0("chr", 1:22), "chrX", "chrY"),
  n = 200,
  l = 1000
)

Arguments

x

An object of class cnaqc.
chrs

The chromosome ids to use (e.g., "chr2"). All are used by default.
n

Disregard chromosome with less than `n` mutations mapped.
l

Disregard chromosome that span less than `l` nucleotide.

Value

A ggplot object of the VAF histogram per segment.

Examples

data('example_dataset_CNAqc', package = 'CNAqc')
x = init(example_dataset_CNAqc$snvs, example_dataset_CNAqc$cna,example_dataset_CNAqc$purity)

#>  [ CNAqc - CNA Quality Check ] 
#> 
#> ℹ Using reference genome coordinates for: GRCh38.
#> ℹ Drivers are annotated, but 'gene' column is missing, using mutation location.
#> ! Missing CCF column from CNA calls, adding CCF = 1 assuming clonal CNA calls.
#> ℹ Input n = 12963 mutations for 267 CNA segments (267 clonal, 0 subclonal)
#> 
#> ✔ Mapped n = 12963 mutations to clonal segments (100% of input)

# Deafault segments -- all chromsomes, at least 1KB, at least 200 mapped mutations.
inspect_segment(x)

#> Warning: `guides(<scale> = FALSE)` is deprecated. Please use `guides(<scale> = "none")` instead.
#> Warning: Removed 30 rows containing missing values (geom_bar).

# Same as above, but only for chromosome 2
inspect_segment(x, chrs = 'chr2', n = 50)

#> Warning: `guides(<scale> = FALSE)` is deprecated. Please use `guides(<scale> = "none")` instead.
#> Warning: Removed 16 rows containing missing values (geom_bar).
